nodes.text: Imperial client states referred to independent sectors that were economically, politically, or militarily subordinate to the Galactic Empire.

These states did not answer directly to Imperial Center, rather owed some form of allegiance to the Empire. They could not oppose the Empire militarily or dared work against the Empire's goals publicly. Some client states were the Corporate Sector Authority and the Centrality, in addition to the few remaining Allied Regions and the Empire of the Hand.
